alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 13 at 4:24AM EST until December 16 at 7:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to three tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph on the ridgetops to the west of I-99. * WHERE...Cambria, Blair, Somerset and Bedford Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Friday morning. The most likely precipitation onset time is Wednesday night or predawn early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Significant travel disruptions are possible. Power outages and tree damage may occur due to the ice. The hazardous travel conditions will likely impact the Thursday morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum ice accumulation in excess of one quarter inch are most likely in the Laurel Highlands. The gradient in snow accumulation will likely increase from southwest to northeast across the watch area, ranging from around 1 inch in southwest Somerset County to up to 4 inches in northern Blair County.
info.instruction: There is the potential for significant winter weather that may impact travel. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
